data.title: - DiscountMags.com
data.text:
StudioSecrets

We reveal who’s recording what and where… Jakub Józef Orliński recorded something a little different in London recently. The star countertenor has created a Baroque album with a jazz twist, with new arrangements of pieces by Purcell, Vivaldi, Monteverdi and Handel by Aleksander Dębicz. It was recorded at Church Studios in Crouch End, with Dębicz on piano, Wojciech Gumiński on bass and Marcin Ułanowski on drums. Erato is set to release the as-yet-untitled album in late 2024. Opera Rara continues to unearth treasures by Donizetti, and its latest project will see the composer’s many songs brought to life on stage and in recordings. Eight album releases are planned in the new series, with Lawrence Brownlee joining Carlo Rizzi in the studio to record tenor songs, for release in the autumn…

You're reading a preview of

Bbc Music (Digital) - 1 Issue, November 2023
